definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: II. In case the gas quantity of users are reduced in breach of the provisions of contracts.
sentences.chinese: 不按合同规定，自行减少或克扣用户气量。

sentences.english: He is a miser,and has penny-pinched himself out of several millions of US dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他是个吝啬鬼，克扣自己而攒下数百万美元。

sentences.english: The workers also claimed that the factory has failed to issue pension payments.
sentences.chinese: 工人还声称工厂克扣社会保险金。

sentences.english: People might try to use "the economy" as an excuse to shortchange you this week.
sentences.chinese: 人们可能会试图用“经济”为借口，克扣你这个星期。

sentences.english: I surely got beaten when I bought rice from a monger.
sentences.chinese: 我从商贩子那里买的米，肯定被克扣了分量。

sentences.english: Her salary was cut short by her boss without any excuse.
sentences.chinese: 她的工资无端被老板克扣。

sentences.english: He is a deceitful cook who skimps on ingredients and shortchanges guests.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个克扣配料，欺骗客人的不老实的厨师。

sentences.english: The brand new Nike ACG Manoa has a look and feel that resembles a working boot.
sentences.chinese: 国际品牌新耐克扣看一看，感觉就像一个工作靴子。

sentences.english: The soldiers lost their will to fight when the general secretly reduced their allowance.
sentences.chinese: 由于将军私自克扣饷银，士兵们几乎没什么斗志。

definition: to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
in arrears/behind in payments/to default on one's debts
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
to embezzle by adding to the payroll employees existing in name only
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
to obtain by impersonation/to falsely claim as one's own
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
